pageContext.claim: “Their plan is projected to hammer the typical American family's income by over $6500 a year, in the Wall Street Journal.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cites the Wall Street Journal, but this figure basically comes from a campaign document that has been laundered through the editorial page in order to lend some authority to the numbers. The claim that Biden's plan would cause household income to decline by $6,500 a year is fiction. The number comes from a report co-written by President Trump’s former chief economic adviser, so it’s clearly designed for campaign weaponization. The $6,500-figure is an estimate for 2030, a decade in the future — not even during a theoretical two-term Biden presidency -- and is disputed by other, more reputable analyses.
